titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alfred von Kiderlen-Wächter Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Manuscripts and Archives Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 08:49

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, speeches, notes and clippings on European political affairs and biographical material of Kiderlen-Wächter, German diplomat and Secretary of State. The most significant and largest portion of his correspondence and notes is that to his mistress, Hedwig Heting Kypke. These papers form a veritable diary of his life and of events in the Foreign Office from 1891 to 1912. Other correspondents include Wilhelm II, Bethmann-Hollweg, von Bulow, Eulenburg-Hertefeld, Marschall von Bieberstein and Alfred Zimmerman.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Alfred von Kiderlen-Wächter Papers (MS 312). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in four series: I. Correspondence. II. Writings and Speeches. III. Subject File. IV. Biographical Material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is divided into two parts: A. Letters to Hedwig (Heting) Kypke and B. General Correspondence.

The bulk of this series (folders 1-109) consists of Kiderlen-Wächter's letters to Hedwig (Heting) Kypke during the years 1891-1912. Following this there is a group of fourteen folders labelled "to Kypke-Excerpts," This material, written in diary or journal form, appears to be Kiderlen's thoughts and notes on various subjects and people. Following this is a group of folders containing correspondence with a range of other political figures. At the end of this series is a folder containing Hedwig Kypke's family correspondence from 1839-1901.

This series contains miscellaneous writings of Kiderlen-Wächter's: a sketchbook, excerpts of memoirs and poems, and his thesis. There are four folders containing descriptions of several of Kaiser Wilhelm's imperial excursions and finally several folders containing drafts of speeches honoring various people.

This series contains correspondence and clippings of a political nature concerning England, German foreign policy, Morocco, Rumania, the Triple Alliance and Turkey. A partial list of the contents of the folders by subject is appended to this register.

This series contains material giving biographical data about Kiderlen-Wächter and also Hedwig Kypke. Several folders contain letters and anecdotal material about Kiderlen, his youth and family background. There is a book entitled Kypke Family Chronicle and a two-page biography of Hedwig Kypke.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Entered German foreign office in 1879; appointed Secretary of State of the Foreign Office in 1910.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: For a published description of collection contents and a listing of subject file folder contents, please consult thePublished Description and Collection Inventory.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes telegram, 3 Oct, from Hofmarshall Freystedl [?] to Kiderlen and bulletin from Agence Fournier, 3 Oct Constantinople.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes undated telegram from Carl [?] to Kiderlen and undated telegram from Elisabeth to Kiderlen [?] with letter of 4 Jan 09.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Theodore Weicher, Dieterich'sche Verlagsbuchhandlung, Leipzig, June; also letter 1909 Feb 29 Julius Lessee [?] to Kiderlen - Kiderlen to Kypke. TREAT FOLDER WITH CARE.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes letter (draft?) to Chancellor, 14 Jun 1910, and letter Gustav Waschow, 3 Jun 1910.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Includes New Year's greeting from Theodor Reuss to Kiderlen and draft of letter from Kiderlen to King of Rumania.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Includes telegram from Elisabeth? and telegram forwarded to Kiderlen from Prince Ferdinand of Rumania.
